[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: ReplaceCandidatePubkey()] [InitialMiners Update] Lines 220-226 update InitialMiners only if old pubkey exists - if it doesn't exist but should, can this create consensus miner list desync? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: ReplaceCandidatePubkey()] [CandidateVotes Manipulation] Lines 229-235 transfer votes from old to new pubkey - can an attacker exploit vote double-counting by timing replacement during vote tallying? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: ReplaceCandidatePubkey()] [CandidateInformation Transfer] Lines 237-243 transfer candidate info - if candidateInformation is null, nothing is transferred, but does this break term counting and reward eligibility for the new pubkey? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: ReplaceCandidatePubkey()] [PerformReplacement Side Effects] Line 184 calls PerformReplacement which updates multiple mappings - if any external contract calls fail in PerformReplacement, can partial replacement state persist? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: ReplaceCandidatePubkey()] [ReplaceCandidateProfitsReceiver External Call] Line 248 calls ReplaceCandidateProfitsReceiver - if TreasuryContract call fails, does the replacement still complete, leaving profit routing broken? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: ReplaceCandidatePubkey()] [Double Replacement] Can the same candidate be replaced multiple times in quick succession, creating circular replacement chains that break GetNewestPubkey logic? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: ReplaceCandidatePubkey()] [Old Pubkey Banning Timing] Line 246 bans old pubkey at the end - if the function reverts after this point, is the old pubkey permanently banned even though replacement failed? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: PerformReplacement()] [CandidateReplacementMap Overwrite] Line 282 sets CandidateReplacementMap[newPubkey] = oldPubkey - if newPubkey was itself a replacement of another key, does overwriting this map entry break the replacement chain? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: PerformReplacement()] [InitialPubkeyMap Logic] Lines 288-289 get or default to oldPubkey - if InitialPubkeyMap[oldPubkey] points to a banned key, can this propagate invalid initial keys to new pubkeys? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: PerformReplacement()] [InitialToNewestPubkeyMap Circular Reference] Line 291 updates InitialToNewestPubkeyMap[initialPubkey] = newPubkey - can creating circular mappings (A->B, B->A) break GetNewestPubkey resolution? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: PerformReplacement()] [Consensus Contract Call Failure] Lines 294-302 call RecordCandidateReplacement - if this fails, does the local state remain updated while consensus state is stale? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: PerformReplacement()] [Vote Contract RemoveOption Revert] Lines 306-318 remove old and add new option to voting - if RemoveOption succeeds but AddOption fails, are votes orphaned with no option to vote for? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: PerformReplacement()] [InitialMiners Exemption] Lines 306-318 skip vote option replacement for InitialMiners - can this be exploited to keep voting for initial miners under their old pubkeys while they mine under new pubkeys? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: PerformReplacement()] [CandidateSponsorMap Transfer] Lines 320-321 transfer sponsor - if CandidateSponsorMap[oldPubkey] is null, does this create an invalid sponsor entry for newPubkey? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: PerformReplacement()] [ManagedCandidatePubkeysMap Corruption] Lines 323-326 update managed pubkeys - if managedPubkeys is null, can this cause null reference exception during Remove/Add operations? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: PerformReplacement()] [Context.Sender Assumption] Line 323 uses Context.Sender assuming it's the admin - but what if this is called from another internal function where Context.Sender is different? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: ReplaceCandidateProfitsReceiver()] [GetProfitsReceiverOrDefault Null Check] Line 262 gets beneficiary but only checks beneficiary.Value.Any() - can beneficiary being null cause exceptions before the Any() check? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: ReplaceCandidateProfitsReceiver()] [TreasuryContract Call Failure] Lines 272-276 call TreasuryContract.ReplaceCandidateProfitsReceiver - if this external call fails, does the election contract's replacement state remain committed? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: ReplaceCandidateProfitsReceiver()] [Conditional Execution] Lines 269-277 only execute if beneficiary.Value.Any() - if no profits receiver exists, is the replacement incomplete, causing future profit distribution failures? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: GetNewestPubkey()] [Circular Reference] Lines 355-356 resolve initialPubkey then look up newest - can circular references in InitialPubkeyMap and InitialToNewestPubkeyMap cause infinite loops? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: GetNewestPubkey()] [Null Coalescing Default] Line 355 defaults to pubkey if InitialPubkeyMap[pubkey] is null - if both mappings are null, does this return an untracked pubkey that breaks consistency? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: GetNewestPubkey()] [No Replacement Validation] No validation that returned newest pubkey is actually a valid, non-banned candidate - can this return banned pubkeys that should be excluded? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: RemoveEvilNode()] [Emergency Org Only] Line 338 requires sender to be EmergencyResponseOrganizationAddress - can a compromised emergency org abuse this to ban all competitors? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: RemoveEvilNode()] [Address Conversion] Line 339 converts pubkey to address without validation - can invalid pubkeys cause address conversion failures that prevent evil node removal? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: RemoveEvilNode()] [Normal Node Prevention] Lines 341-343 prevent removing normal nodes not in Candidates or InitialMiners - can an attacker pre-register a pubkey in Candidates then claim they can't be removed even if evil?
